content.detailedDescription: It was a little after 11:00 pm, i was sitting in my back yard, looking up to the sky to watch a few of the neighborhood fireworks.  then, at approximately 11:11, i saw the first one.  coming from the west, i saw a bright reddish/orange oval shaped object flying in the sky.  i would say it was pretty high up in the sky.  it wasnt as if it were an object going up from the ground like a firework.   there was a definate flight path.  it was moving at a speed similar to what one would see if looking at a plane up in the sky.  i saw it travel for at least one or two minutes, then it just disappeared.  i called my husband out, he saw it too.  about 3 minutes later, we saw another one, coming from the west, but not from the same point in the sky.  we watched it travel for the same amount of time, then it, too, disappeared, but it disappeared in the same area in my vantage point as the previous one had. the third one appeared from a different direction of the west (more southwest, i would say), and it was so bright, i could see it coming toward us across the sky through the trees in my backyard.  it too, headed in the same direction (west to northeast) and disappeared at about the same spot that the first two had. i went upstairs to grab my cel phone to see if my son had seen anything, and about 3 minutes in the phone call, i saw another one coming from the west, more north then the other three, and it also disappeared in the same area of the other 3.  these were not quick sightings.  all 4 were visable for at least one or two minutes, if not longer.  they looked like a bright reddish/orange color.  almost like the color of fire.  best description of the color i would say is, sometimes when the sun sets, it becomes a glowing, firey color.  they reminded me of fire, just by the color.  the night was clear, so i could see there was no vapor trail.  no smoke trail, nothing like that.  i did notice the one that came overhead had no sound.  these were not fireworks.  they all four came from a different direction in the western sky. they were big enough for my husband and i to see them.  and they all four went toward the same area in the sky and then completely just disappeared. when these ovals of fire disappeared, they became white first, then disappeared. when they did become white, it was as if they then in a way, began to look like a star, but not as bright.  then they just faded out. it was strange. i have never in my life seen anything like it.  when i saw the first one, i knew there was something strange going on, and when i saw 3 more of them, i was completely amazed.  shocked in a way, to witness so many of them at one time. i kept wanting to see more and more, because i just could not believe what i was seeing. if not for my husband seeing them, also, i really dont know anyone would have believed me.  with it being july 4th, people dismiss it as fireworks.  well....These ovals of fire that was traveling miles above the earth, were not fireworks.  they came from different directions, disappeared in the same area.  and honestly, one of my first thoughts was:  what a perfect night for them to be out.  with all the fireworks, they must have thought that they were blending right in.  it only makes sense they would have picked last night to do a flyby.
content.summary: 4 reddish/orange ovals, heading from west to north east.

content.detailedDescription: These pictures go with the other mackinaw city sighting. i placedthe wrong photo's , my apology
content.summary: These pictures go with other mackinaw sighting i put the wrong photos

content.detailedDescription: Pictures of crafts over st. mary's river. i did not know they were there until i look at them later. there are two different kinds of crafts and i have no idea what they are. one od they is like a tri-circular and glow and the other is a boomarang shape.
content.summary: Picture taken of a rainbow over st. mary's river. when i looked at the pictures i noticed the crafts.

content.detailedDescription: I was at thunder falls in mackinaw city i took pictures of the park, when i got home inoticed orbs in the pictures. it seems as though orbs are travelling through the beams coming from above. it almost looks like a spider web and upon closer examination i realized these beams were coming from the sky and were going behind people. please look closley. i also took a picture of the mackinaw island from the bridge and when i got home i noticed a craft in picture. i have no idea what kind of craft it is.
content.summary: I was taking pictures at thunder falls and noticed orbs in the pics after. it looks like there are orbs travelling down the beams of light. i also took a photo of mackinaw island from the bridge and noticed a craft in it when i got home.

content.detailedDescription: I was waiting to watch the cleveland fireworks begin last night on the shores of lake erie when suddenly a large red fireball appeared 5000' to the west of my position at an altitude about 800'. the craft just seemed to appear in the burst of a residential non-commercial firework. initially catching my eye because it looked stationary and not moving. it looked 40 to 60 feet or more across, circular in shape, solid red in color with a hint of white. much like the running lights of a boat with the anchor light behind as if approaching you from the port bow. i estimate the fireball was half the size of my pinkie fingernail at an arms length away at first. there was also a commercial type aircraft further off to the west when i noticed the strange light. the other aircraft was traveling north to south with strobe and aviation lights working at an altitude of roughly 2000'. i mentioned to the others that also observed this, faa regulations would require the craft to have proper lighting as did the more distant aircraft. the fireball object slowly approached flew nearly directly overhead then sort of blinked before it completely disappeared at about 700 yards or so to the east. the craft remained red in color as it passed overhead, but, seemed to shape shift from circular to a thimble shape before it vanished. several people in my immediate vicinity noticed the craft yelling out "look it's a ufo" and "that was really abby normal" i was at wendy park located next to the whiskey island marina just west of the mouth of the cuyahoga river very near downtown cleveland. i believe several hundreds of other people may have witnessed this as well, the incident occurred at 9:56 pm.
content.summary: Large red fireball appeared 5000' to the west at an altitude 800' flew nearly directly overhead then suddenly vanished about 700 yards to the east.

content.detailedDescription: On april 13, 2006 i was sitting on my couch and had my camera beside me because the day before i was driving home from picking my 2 boys up from school when i saw a silver,shiny, disc shaped craft hovering over the water( st mary's river) not moving at all. i slammed on the brakes and just starred at it. in disbelief i asked the boys who were 6 and 9 at the time if they were seeing what i saw. the boys said mom is that a ufo. at that point i knew i was not going crazy and they were seeing what my eyes were. it was not that far from us it was about 150 feet infront of us and as wide as the road. the road ends at the water with my street going vertical to the water.The disc was so shiny like aluminum or even crome. it had no seams , windows or doors, just solid shaped as a disc, like a horizontal oval. the next night on april 13, 2006 is when i saw something in my front yard and i actually got many pictures and a video of it(a short video). i have not wanted to come forward with this because i am an upstanding member of my community, i coach sports and don't want to be thought of as a nut case. but i cannot stop thinking about what happen ed to me that night and i need to share my evidence to prove that they really do exist and i have many different pictures from many different times. i will share my evidence with you but i am not comfortable dicussing what happened to me after i took the pictures(not yet anyway) and i want to forget it. although i want to share every piece of evidence i have with you. the pictures in my front yard were of lights (they were red and white and i think with brightening the pictures you can see part of a craft and honestly i think of the being . it looks just like the pictures that everyone describes them of with the big head and about 4 feet tall. to see this in the pictures you need the brighten and magnify them as the pictures were taken at night through my front window. i have had several encounters, so have my parents.In the 1950's my great uncle *name deleted--sgonzalez/cms who is 87 now was fishing on a lake with a friend and watched as a ufo disc shaped land on shore and he said he saw two beings in silver suits get out and take samples of the water and the soil before he hurried to get to shore. before he is gone i hope that someone documents what happened to him as well.To get back to april 13, 2006 the lights were so bright that it seemed like spot lights shining in through the window while i was watching t.V.There was no sound at all.  it's like it landed on my front lawn. my front lawn has large pine trees all along the front. the moon is on the pictures so you can judge size. i was so scared but i knew what it was when i pulled the blinds back to look because of what had happened to me the day before. it sounds crazy to even tell this but this is true and people need to know what is happening and that they are around us everyday. any way i have so much more to tell, but this is enough for now. if you would like more information, please contact me because i feel what i have experienced is more than most and my family has other personal experiences on top of my own. i am not he best at describing things , i hope this is good enough. i will try to send my pictures with this. i could only send 3 i hve more pictures that go with this.
content.summary: I saw lights outside my front living room window, i grabbed my camera and started taking pictures and short video. the lights were like helicopters were shining in with no sound, i think i have pictures of craft and beings.Pictures must be magnified.

content.detailedDescription: Around 11:25 pm on july 4, 2010 i was inside my house looking at fireworks from our front window when i noticed multiple reddish- orange/white objects (12-18) at varying levels of altitude traveling in a general northeast to southwest direction.  they caught my attention as they did not disappear immediately, as fireworks do, and there were multiple distinct objects.  i observed them for 1-2 minutes.  they were traveling in direct relationship with each other.  they were neither fireworks, flares, weather balloons or aircraft that i could identify.  i then called my husband to look at them and he ran outside and he could not identify them either(he is an airline captain).  we watched as the group flew in loose formation at different altitudes.  my husband got a camera out of the house but was unable to get a picture of them.  as he was attempting to take pictures, a small airplane started flying over our house in a south/southwest direction towards portland international airport and as it approached the group of objects, from our line of sight, the objects started to independently blink out until they had all disappeared.  a military neighbor ran over to our house and said he saw them from the corner of his eye and could not determine what they were.  the objects did not reappear.  all of our reactions were that we had seen a group of ufo objects.  we were not happy that we were unable to get pictures of them before they blinked out.  there was a feeling of unreality of our actual sighting and we are still processing those feelings.
content.summary: 12-18 reddish-orange/white objects traveling in uneven formation ne to sw.

content.detailedDescription:
Glowing orange-red ball, moving in a straight path, low altitude, flew in front of the whole town of peaple at a fireworks display. went right over our heads, no sound at all, seemed to be an aircraft that was engulfed in an orange ball of light, moving without any noise what so ever. i did see the object agian 07/04/10 aprox same time 9pm flying in a different derection, but lower to the earth, almost over the house.

 at first sighting it seemed to be an aircraft without any thrust or navigation lights. then realized that there was no propulsion sound at all. when the object was directly over head it did have a plane like feature, however it was surounded by a glowing orange-red ball of light. there were no signs of thrust from the rear of the object.
content.summary: Glowing orange-red ball, moving in a straight path,

content.detailedDescription: I was outside getting some fresh air and taking my dogs outside when i happened to look up and saw what could be described as an orange orb that has a small light (transparent) shining on the tops of homes.  it almost looked like a helicopter that looks for criminals, but the orb was glowing bright orange.  it then pulsed a few times, and as i stood there, it blinked out of sight.  i have not drank in 9 years and no drugs, so i know what i saw.  i also noticed that what felt like a few minutes was actually 38.  i am still very shaken, i have never believed in ufos or other beings, but my body feels strange and no idea what to do next.  can someone help?
content.summary: Orange ball shining light on homes then pulsed and disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: I was at a concert on louisville's watefront. (1,000's in attendance)(kentucky-side, facing idiana on ohio river) it was sundown and music was definitely in full swing.  i guess because it was fourth of july many people were looking up at helicopters or planes flying into sdf airport.  i forget which one of us noticed it, but my boyfriend and i saw what seemed to be a red-orange glowing craft.  burning, moreso than glowing like a light.  it was at a very high altitude but you could tell it was moving east at an incredible rate.  it didn't jump around or go from point a to b in a snap as some people describe sightings.  but it wasn't hovering either.  you could just tell that it was way higher than a plane would be around an airport but moving across the sky as a whole super-fast.  i imagine this thing was actually very huge to scale.  as we were on our way to the port-o-john's, we noticed others saw the exact same thing.  then, following it with our feet and our eyes, we noticed 2 others way further east up-river.  it seemed as though they were rotating around eachother and us, and then disappeared into the sunset.  like you could blink your eye and they were no more!  i got super excited to see my first ufo as well as my boyfriend as we are firm believers and further more skeptical of government cover-ups.  as excited as i am, i also feel betrayed as the government cannot seem to open up and that we do want to meet them!!!
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Orange glow, slightly white in middle, up at great altitude, but moving extremely fast.

content.detailedDescription: While watching fireworks, my daughter, my wife and myself observed a orange circular light moving from west to east. i observed the light had no strobes or nav lights and made no sound, it also seemed to pulse. when the light was almost directly overhead it slowly faded out.
content.summary: Orange light traveling west to east, no sound, strobes or nav lights.

content.detailedDescription: I was pulling up behind my house when i saw an orange light in the sky coming in my direction, being the fourth of july night i assumed fireworks. it didn't fade, explode or change directions, i live by an air base so i thought strange plane at this point, i shut off my car and music and got out to listen to see if it made a jet noise, it was probably within a half mile of my location at this point. no sound whatsoever!  i was freaked out at this point and ran inside to grab my wife to see it too to make sure i wasn't crazy, by the time we got back outside it was traveling away from us, she was blown away-she also saw four silver/white legs equidistant around the center which was an orange, glowing spinning sphere. it went east-northeast not more than 1500-2000 ft off the ground, about 45 sec to 1 min speed horizon to horizon. it disappeared behind some trees and we couldn't get in location to see it anymore. we were amazed and in disbelief at what we saw. i got on here and saw others around the country saw the same thing and had to share.
content.summary: Orange fireball, silent, traveling in straight line east-northeast.

content.detailedDescription: My two friends and i were driving on i-77 south, 2 miles before the pleasant valley exit, when i looked through my sunroof and saw the ufo which was the size of a dime. it was hovering at helecopter height but made no sound. it stayed stationary directly above me for some time. it had a clear circlular shape with an orange glow around the whole craft. at the center was a bright red light. as i exited the highway and came to a stop at the traffic light, i saw the object move slowly then quickly vanished as i took my eyes off it breifly, it only had seconds to move far enough for me to no longer see it. note that as the distance between me and the object grew, less of the orange light was visible. also its glow lost the perfectly circular shape as the light was only visible on the bottom half of the object due to the angle that i was observing the now disk shaped object. the red light was only visible directly under the craft. it only took a short distance for it to disappear. during the encounter, the object stayed relativly close to my postion, which was close to a large electrical sub-station. all three people in the car agree on the caracteristics and did not have characteristics of a helicopter, plane, blimp, etc.
content.summary: Glowing orange circle at helecopter altitude stationary then moving

content.detailedDescription:
This evening i went outside (with my camera) to first water the flowers as it was scorchingly hot today & still the lingering hot air made it difficult to breath. i stood still for a moment concentrating of where in the sky to aim my camera , as i couldn't see the spaceships . i took 3 photos in total . the 1st one that i've aimed in the es direction only showed couple of tiny white dots on the iphoto screen . the 2nd photo once loaded it basically looked at first as a gray page, this photo was taken in the we direction, & once i begun zooming in by approx. 1 cm x 2cm squeres , than the white orbs begun to be seen.
these 2 photos i've pushed the zoom to 8x the maximum my camera allows , so the light orbs are a bit fuzzy . the 3rd photo was aimed at the direct w where the sun just went below the horizon level & the colorful bands can be seen (sun sets at this time of yr just to the left of the highrise building in the photo). again i've zoomed this particular image on the iphoto (the camera too was at about 5x zoom), & there were some white ufo orbs , some appeared further back , others obviously were closer as they are a bit bigger & there were also 4 black stealth type jets high up in the sky . there are also dark scratch like lines & dots those are the airplanes as the airport is to the right of the sun setting . but the most buffling thing in that picture is an "object" about halfway right side which i cannot determine of what it could be , & that's why i'm attaching it with this report . 
mufon's experts can better manipulate the zoom perhaps on photoshop as i haven't learned yet of how to use this application . 
btw , the first image i contrasted a bit so the white lights would be more visible , due to the hight elevation they're very small indeed .
also , yesterday at about 9 pm & over the lake , but higher then the incoming 2 jets were 6-7 flushes in the sky , those were in the just past mid point between e to s . few hours later a helicopter was making rounds . that is the reason i wait few hrs to report these sightings & sometimes i don't .
content.summary: Ufos at extraordinary height & few black military jets, on zoomed in images.

content.detailedDescription: I was viewing neighborhood fireworks from my backyard.  i saw a rapidly moving object which looked similar to a star in appearance.  the object was at an extremely high altitude and alternating speeds from fast to slow.  the object's travel path was slightly curved.  while curiously viewing the object, it suddenly stopped, became tremendously bright similar to a camera flash, and changed colors from white to red.  after two or three seconds, it resumed its star-like appearance and continued to travel in its curved path at varying rates of speed.  upon viewing the object for an additional thirty seconds or so, it abruptly disappeared.  as soon as the original object disappeared, another star-like object appeared and was traveling in the opposite direction at varying rates of speed.  i proceeded to view this object for approximately thirty seconds before it traveled out of my sight.  the entire encounter lasted for about a minute and a half.  my wife was witness to the second object which i saw.  i must admit that i became a bit spooked when the object flashed because it appeared to flash in my direction even though it was so far away.  definately not fireworks.  the objects were in view for a long time, and they were very high in the air.  definately above the level of any planes that we would ever see flying overhead.
content.summary: Rapid then slow moving object similar in appearance to a star suddenly brightened and changed color.

content.detailedDescription:
I was attending the horse races with my family and the races were over and the fireworks were about to start.  they wait for it to be dark before they start the fireworks and someone i was with my wife girlfriend said hey look a ufo or something like that.  the three of us looked and it was no plane because its right by ohara airport in chicago and the planes were coming in with the firework show i though they or looked  like at times a couple of the planes could get hit.  anyway we saw it three time moving the same speed as a plane(maybe a little slower) but it looked orange or yellow in the middle sorrounded by a oranger color almost like a fireball or flame it moved across the sky in the same location three time in a total of 10 mins i saw it for the third time.  i was too busy trying to show and tell other people and whatching it that i didn't think about a phone picture it would of looked like crap anyway....
if it was an alien race should they be smart enought as not to make it so obvouise to know its a ufo or just enough to show the people with an open mind
content.summary: A fire looking object flying by 3 times.

content.detailedDescription:
Tonight after the fireworks, my boyfriend and i were walking back to our car. he looked up and said, "what's that?".
i looked and said, "i don't know". it was a burning flame that just hovered and seemed suspended, high up in the sky.
we stood watching this for about 2-3 minutes and another man stopped and looked up, too. he said, "what's that?". we both replied, "we don't know". never seen anything like that before. (this was about 10:18 cst)in the southern sky. the flame looked orange and yellow and eventually got smaller and smaller, until it disappeared. p.S. there was someone else who posted ufo and 2 witnesses and now the post appears to be gone. i joined glp tonight because i too saw this and wanted to add to his post. no pics. my boyfriend's iphone wasn't able to photograph this. there were 3 of us that stood there watching this in disbelief.
content.summary: It was a burning flame that just hovered and seemed suspended, high up in the sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was out side with my family shooting off fire works and i look out in to the field and above the tree line was a big red fire ball at first i thought it was a fire work but then it got brighter and sped up a little bit i watched it move across the tree's it was just above them then it got higher and started moving up and dimmed down just a little then one of my family members looked up at it with me and we watched it as it got brighter again and we stood up to get a better look and it just stopped and got brighter and then it got real dim and started to fade till it was gone it only took it about 5 seconds to disappear it was round and looked like a fire ball to me or a commit it started about 35 miles away and moved till it was only about 4 or 5 miles away it was a bright red almost an orange red that's about all i can remember.
content.summary: I thought it was a fire work at first.

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend,my cousin's wife,cousin's two small children,and i were lighting firecrackers (note:only the kind that bang,no lights.) in a field beside my grandparent's house...We live in the country,surrounded by family..The sky is very dark at night,and no fireworks were being shot for at least a couple miles..We heard none and saw no other lights that could have been produced by fireworks (just wanted to get that out of the way). i was sitting on the ground looking up towards *(name deleted--sgonzalez/cms),my cousin's wife,when i saw a greenish orange (thats the best way i know how to explain it,i have no idea how to fully describe the color..Very strange) flattened oval shaped light zip across the sky horizontally. it moved in a straight line at first,gaining no altitude...And it was very large,much bigger than any plane or helicopter ive ever seen...Anyway,i shouted "look!" and *(name deleted--sgonzalez/cms)and my girlfriend **(name deleted--sgonzalez/cms)turned to look where i was pointing and it flashed again...**(name deleted--sgonzalez/cms)described it as looking like a lightbulb under a lampshade,like a glow coming from inside...We all watched as it sort of doubled back on its path and flashed again. i asked everyone what they thought it was and no one had an answer..All agree though that it couldnt have been fireworks or any kind of aircraft we've seen...I'm not saying it was alien,just unidentifiable. i decided to report this (it happened about two hours ago) in hopes that someone might come across it who either witnessed the same event or something similar. my email address is blake_rollo@yahoo.Com  i dont mind anyone sending me replies to this query
content.summary: Green/yellow/orange flash very high up flew in semi circle much higher than treetops very large.

content.detailedDescription: We were watching fireworks on the west side of town sitting in our car. saw a yellowish light in the sky, thought it was fireworks at first, but it kept moving slowly across the sky and passed just on the south of us. it was fairly low in the sky. got out of the car for a better view and it kept moving with out the light diminishing.Two others soon followed heading west. we watched until they disappeared. there was no sound noted from the objects and no positioning lights. we decided to head west out of town to see if we could sight them again. about one mile out of town on a dark road noticed what appeared to be a bright star low in the sky. we pulled over and observed it to see if would move. it stood still then it shifted to one side and then back again before heading to the south. then it just disappeared from sight.
content.summary: Watching fireworks saw yellowish light in sky heading west followed by two others on same course.

content.detailedDescription:
I was in my driveway talking on my cell phone when the party i was conversing with asked to me to hold the line while he observed something.  while waiting, my eyes were on the sky i watched my neighbors shoot off fireworks.  i saw what i thought to be a burning ember in the sky.  

upon closer inspection, i noticed this object was not falling; it was moving in a horizontal line, at great speed from southeast to northwest.  the object was a bright orange light, large and oval in shape, and made no sound.  the light appeared to dim and brighten several times as it moved through the sky.

while observing this object, i mentioned my sighting to the person i was talking to on the phone, and he confirmed that it was the same thing he was observing 70 miles northwest of my location. 

eventually i lost sight of it as the light suddenly disappeared.
content.summary: Orange light traveling southeast to northwest.

content.detailedDescription:
1. where were you and what were you doing at the time?
we were facing due east watching fireworks from our back yard. 

2. what made you first notice the object?
we were watching the sky for fireworks when we noticed a glowing object to the south. 

3. what did you think the object was when you first noticed it?
initially, we assumed it was a firework, but quickly realized that it wasn't. it was not an aircraft because it had no flashing lights indicative of an airplane or helicopter. 

4. describe the object and its actions and motions.
the object was a glowing orange/amber circular shape. it maintained altitude and traveled on a flat trajectory (south to north) across the horizon. it left no trail (contrail or smoke) and made no sound. it was not a firework, airplane, or helicopter. we have two airports in close proximity and see air traffic regularly. the object remained visible for roughly one minute, until it moved over the north horizon. the cloud cover reported at lambert international airport (25 miles away) was cloudy at 7,000 ft and mostly cloudy at 15,000 ft. the object must have been below 15,000 ft in order to have remained visible. 

there was just enough time for my wife to grab our digital camera from the kitchen and shoot one picture before we lost sight of it. 

5. describe your feelings, reactions and actions, during and after sighting the object.
we were curious and watched intently because it was clearly not behavior consistent with aircraft or fireworks. we were intrigued because we've never seen anything similar to this before.

6. how did you lose sight of the object?
it disappeared from view as it went over the horizon to the north. 

i've attached the picture that was taken. i used the highlight option in hp imagezone software to lighten it. the object that we saw is in the center of the photo toward the top. it was much more orange/amber to the naked eye, but the picture makes it appear more white in color. we did not see the orb left of center until we reviewed the picture on our pc. none of the three adults present saw the second orb. we were all focused on the glowing object.
content.summary: Orange/amber glowing sphere moving south to north.

content.detailedDescription: Me and my mom and dad were sitting on our back porch just enjoying the july 4th holiday.  our backyard is very dark with no lights on so it's very easy to see the sky.  i was just sitting and i turned and looked in front of me in the sky and i saw what i thought to be a star.  i realized that it wasn't because it was much more bright and much closer than a star would be, it was hard to tell but it almost looked like it was above the house like 10 houses up the street.  it just stayed in one spot but i stared at it since it just seemed odd looking to me.  i asked my mom to get up and look up and she saw it as well.  at that point it started to move right and then backtracked and headed left at a steady rate and then just dissapeared.  we thought it was weird and sat back down.  about 2 minutes later i noticed another light in the same spot i had saw the other and as i stared i realized it was getting brighter like the last one i had seen.  i called to my mom again and she looked and spotted it too.  let me reiterate it was extremely bright.  i had my dad look too and he could see it, that's saying alot on how bright and how close it was because he has sight problems and can't even see the stars in the sky at all.  i could see it was staying in one spot but i could see it moving a little bit like trying to hover in one spot and then it proceeded to move left again.  at this point it went dim and started to pulse a much dimmer light at a constant rate as it moved.  my dad had trouble seeing it as this point.  of course we didn't have our camera since my sister had taken it with her to the shore.  we got out the binoculars and it was hard to see anything because the light around it just made it blurry when looked close up.  we followed it as far as we could before we lost sight of it behind trees.  very weird and unexplainable to me.  there were other planes in the sky at this point so i could compare to them and it was nothing like them, the lights weren't the same, it was much bigger or at least closer than the planes by far.  it didn't make any noise either, we can hear planes when they go by and we heard absolutely nothing, the fireworks had ceased too so it was completely silent in our backyard.  we sat out there for another half hour and never saw anything after that.  very cool in my book.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Bright star like object in sky moving around.

content.detailedDescription: My neighbors and i were lighting fireworks at dusk to celebrate the 4th of july, on the southwest side of ypsilanti near ann arbor. my landlord was the first to see the objects approaching from the southwest. he said "we're being invaded" and drew our attention to the sky. i looked up and saw 6 orange orbs moving across the southern sky from southwest to northeast. my first reaction was that they must be some type of fireworks. but more of them continued to appear from behind a cloud, moving silently at a speed and altitude comprable to airliners. i didn't get an exact count but i estimate i saw 12-15 objects total, including one that was trailing far behind the others. i tried to get video on my iphone but the exposure was too low and the objects were not very bright. i can best describe them as looking like orange signal flares, but flares don't move like aircraft. they didn't move erraticaly in any way. they just kept a steady, straight course in a fixed cluster formation. they are similar to other lights that had been seen in arizona several years ago. they passed behind another cloud and i didn't see them again. i wasn't scared because they didn't appear threatening in any way. the children (ages 6 through 12) got excited but didn't seem scared. i imagine that, given the date and timing of the sighting, there are widespread eyewitnesses of this event, as many people happened to be outdoors looking at the sky at the same time. i hope someone got some more quality video than i did.
content.summary: Fleet of 12-15 orange orbs in formation

content.detailedDescription: My wife, niece and i were watching fireworks from our front yard on july 4th 2010. at 9:15 pm i notice what at first i thought was a firework shot into the air, it was very bright almost flarelike. i  thought it was getting ready to explode but it never did. we watched as it moved from the sw to ne. at one point it appeared that it sped up then slowed down again. then suddenly it appeared to go verticle getting smaller and smaller until it disappeared. my wife and i both agree it was definitely not an airplane or anything else we have ever see because of how brilliant it was and the stange way in which it was flying.
content.summary: Three of us watching fireworks on the 4th of july 2010 saw a very bright red-orange object move accross the sky, then suddenly go verticle and get smaller and smaller until finally disappearing.

content.detailedDescription: Watching fireworks on back balcony at about 10:45pm and saw red globe in sky, thought it was firework parachute but it did not fall or extinguish out but glided nearer to our house and got bigger in size and brighter in red color.  it just glided then stopped wavered back and forth then continued to glide over our house.  i nervously banged on bedroom window to get my sons attention but kept my eyes fixed on the object.  my sons came out and seen it as well as my neighbor who asked, "what is that". no noise, no blinking lights of any kind.  if just kept going, kind of like a glide, and we lost sight of it because of neighborhood trees.  my younger son has seen this several times over last year late at night when he goes out to smoke a cigarette.  i finally saw it tonight and it was my first ufo sighting!!!!  i'll be out late at night back there now and hope to see it again.
content.summary: Red round globe gliding towards my house and definitely not fireworks.

content.detailedDescription:
I encouraged my family to come outside to check out the stars from our backyard because the sky was clear and brilliant with many stars. while gazing at the sky, on several occasions, we would see what initially appeared to be a star move across the sky, what was most captivating was that the objects changed direction very easily & at times made jerky movements as they moved along. we watched many of these objects continue until they were out of sight, though some would seem as if perhaps they ascended because they would appear smaller until they were out of view. 

these objects did not flash or move like airplanes, in fact we had seen many airplanes during that time and clearly the objects were much higher and smaller than airplanes. the way these objects traveled was abrupt and the duration of time they would move suggested that these objects moved at a very high speed and covered a great distance in a short period of time.
we saw a total of 12 objects during an 1.5hrs.
the objects just kept coming, it was surprising and exhilarating it proved to me that there is plenty of activity up in space and the fact that my entire family saw it was awesome.
july 4 2010
content.summary: Several objects seen over connecticut, naugatuck valley.

content.detailedDescription:
At approximately 10:15 pm, july 4, i was out in my front yard with my dog, when i witnessed in the sky an orange-red object, about 3x to 5x the size of a planet, approaching from the southwest approximately 25 to 35 degrees above the horizon.

the size and shape of the object was difficult to judge at night, but the shape of what appeared to be a "single light" was round or spherical.  the object maintained a straight line course moving from the southwest to the northeast.

when i first observed the object i thought it was an airplane off in the distance approaching our home, but as it got closer and went past my home overhead , i heard no sound and could not see any flashing strobe or navigation lights on the object.

as the object approached and receded, the apparent size of the object did not appear to increase or decrease signficantly.  the object appeared to be at a constant altitude and moved at a constant/uniform velocity.  there was no change in the object's flight path, it moved in a straight line.  the total time i observed the object was about 30 to 45 seconds until it disappeared behind some clouds as it moved past and behind my house as it continued to move in a straight line path to the northeast.

perhaps the object was a satellite in low earth orbit, but the size of the orange-red light seemed too large to be a satellite 70 to 80 miles above the surface.  if the object was a small plane at low altitude, i would have expected to hear engine noise, if the object was a jet aircraft at high altitude, i would have expected the object to have taken longer to traverse the sky, given the high altitude.
content.summary: Orange-red object moving silently across sky.

content.detailedDescription: At approximately 9:35pm central time, we were at auditorium shores in austin tx, watching the fireworks show and  someone yelled out " a ufo" and we looked up to see this object moving steadily at about 150mph, not sure on the exact speed, through the sky heading nw. this object looked like molten fire. it had a glowing red to it, like molten rock. it was not a meteor and i dont believe it to be a satellite on fire, because i have witnessed that before. it was not a hot air balloon nor an airplane. there were no blinking lights on this object. it was hard to tell the elevation of the object, but its elevation was steady, it was not descending. it disappeared heading northwest and took about 20 seconds to disappear. this object was not a plane. it freaked my wife and i out, and we were not drinking alcohol when this occurred.
content.summary: Molten fire ball flying steadily through tx sky.

content.detailedDescription:
I was looking out my window approx 11:30pm watching some of the nearby fireworks, and i saw coming towards me over my house just over the tree tops approx. just a little smaller than a bowling ball  a sphere shaped orange fireball with a white glow around it just floating thru the sky and then i saw another one about 30 seconds later seem to follow this one but then never came over the tree tops , just saw the orange glow and it must have turned and went another direction.  over the levittown area near pennsbury high school.  my daughter told me about 2 hours previous she saw exactly the same two fireballs.  over levittown, near levittown pky approx 9:00pm.  no sounds, just floating like it was a fire enclosed in a white mist.  
earlier around noon of july 4th, by oxford valley mall and target on rt 1, langhorne i saw what i first thought was an airplane but it didn't have any sound, wings or anything just a silver cigar shaped object floating very slowly in the daytime sky. i was waiting at the light and looking forward and saw it.  floating lower than where i see planes fly.
content.summary: Orange fireball looking sphere just floating thru the sky.
